entries: Channel your adrenaline into a Devastating Bash, knocking {@condition prone} and inflicting {@condition weakness|GuildWars}.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone} and suffers from {@condition weakness|GuildWars} for the duration.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.

{@bold Adrenaline.} Instead of expending a spell slot, you cast this spell by expending 7 adrenaline. When casting this spell at a higher level, expend an additional 7 adrenaline per level above the original level.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Devastating Hammer
Elite Hammer Attack. If Devastating Hammer hits, your target is knocked down and suffers from Weakness for 5...17...20 seconds.

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or 3rd level, the number of attacks increases by 1. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the number of attacks increases by 2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 3.

spell.name: Melandru's Arrows
entries: Sheath your arrows in Melandru's wild magic, making them inflict bleed and deal extra damage against enchanted foes.

For the duration, when you hit a target with a ranged weapon attack, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target starts {@condition bleeding|GuildWars} for 1 minute, taking {@damage 2d4} damage. Additionally, if a target is under the effect of a beneficial spell, they take {@damage 2d6} damage.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
{@bold Preparation.} If you cast a new preparation, this preparation ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Melandru's Arrows
Elite Preparation. For 18 seconds, whenever your arrows hit, they cause Bleeding for 3...21...25 seconds, and if they hit a target who is under an enchantment, they do +8...24...28 damage.

components.m: a hand full of sharp rocks

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd and the damage of the {@condition bleeding|GuildWars} condition increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Peace and Harmony
entries: Invoke peace and harmony on a creature, removing negative effects and reducing their duration.

Choose one friendly creature that you can see within range. End the latest two of the following conditions on the target: {@condition Corruption|GuildWars}, {@condition Disease|GuildWars}, {@condition blinded|phb|Blindness}, {@condition Dazed|GuildWars}, {@condition Bleeding|GuildWars}, {@condition Crippled|GuildWars}, {@condition Burning|GuildWars}, {@condition Weakness|GuildWars}, {@condition Cracked Armor|GuildWars}, or {@condition Deep Wound|GuildWars}. Additionally, the latest two harmful spells on the target end.
For the duration, conditions and harmful spells expire 90% faster on the target.

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Peace and Harmony

Elite Enchantment Spell. Target ally loses 0...7...9 condition[s] and hex[es]. For 1...3...3 second[s], conditions and hexes expire 90% faster on that ally. All your Smiting Prayers are disabled for 20 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, one additional spell and condition ends for each slot level above 2nd and the duration increases by 1 round for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Plague Signet
entries: Activate your Plague Signet to transfer most of your conditions to an enemy.

Choose one hostile creature that you can see within range. The target gains a copy of each of the following conditions on yourself: {@condition Bleeding|GuildWars}, {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Burning|GuildWars}, {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Corruption|GuildWars}, {@condition Cracked Armor|GuildWars}, {@condition Crippled|GuildWars}, {@condition Dazed|GuildWars}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Deep Wound|GuildWars}, {@condition Disease|GuildWars}, {@condition Exhaustion}, {@condition Frightened}, {@condition Poisoned}, {@condition Weakness|GuildWars}. End all copied conditions on yourself.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw for each condition affecting it. On a success, that condition ends.
{@bold Signet.} Casting this spell does not cost a spell slot. Once you cast this spell, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Plague Signet
Elite Signet. Transfer all negative conditions with 100...180...200% of their remaining durations from yourself to target foe. (50% failure chance with Curses 4 or less.)

spell.name: Dwarven Battle Stance
entries: Channel the ancient fighting style of the dwarfs, gaining an additional attack, taking less damage and disrupting foes with your attack as long as you are using a heavy weapon.

For the duration, if you are wielding a melee weapon with the heavy property, you can attack one additional time when you take the attack action on your turn, when you take damage, you can roll {@dice 4d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage, and when you hit a target a melee weapon attack, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't cast a spell or use an ability on their next turn.
{@bold Stance.} If you enter a new stance, this stance ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Dwarven Battle Stance
Elite Stance. For 5...10...11 seconds, if you are wielding a hammer, you attack 33% faster, you gain +40 armor, and your attack skills interrupt foes when they hit.

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp with the heavy property

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Melandru's Resilience
entries: Channel the nature goddess Melandru, reinforcing yourself with rejuvenating vines, healing every turn and potentially reducing your spell cost for each condition or hex affecting you.

For the duration, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} per condition or harmful spell affecting you. Additionally, while at least suffering from one condition or harmful spell, when you would expend a spell slot to cast a spell of 1st level, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 19 or higher, the spell does not expend a spell slot. Reduce the number you need to roll by 1 for each condition or harmful spell affecting you beyond the first, to a minimum of 10.
If you drop to 0 hit points, this spell ends.
{@bold Stance.} If you enter a new stance, this stance ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Melandru's Resilience
Elite Stance. For 8...18...20 seconds, you gain +4 Health regeneration and +1 Energy regeneration for each condition and hex you are suffering.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Restore Condition
entries: Purge most conditions on a creature and heal them for each condition removed.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. End {@condition Corruption|GuildWars}, {@condition Disease|GuildWars}, {@condition blinded|phb|Blindness}, {@condition Dazed|GuildWars}, {@condition Bleeding|GuildWars}, {@condition Crippled|GuildWars}, {@condition Burning|GuildWars}, {@condition Weakness|GuildWars}, {@condition Cracked Armor|GuildWars}, and {@condition Deep Wound|GuildWars} on the target and the target regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} per condition removed.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Restore Condition

Elite Spell. Remove all conditions (Poison, Disease, Blindness, Dazed, Bleeding, Crippled, Burning, Weakness, Cracked Armor, and Deep Wound) from target other ally. For each condition removed, that ally is healed for 10...58...70 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Soul Leech
entries: Attach a soul leech to a creature, siphoning off health every time they cast a spell.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save for the duration when the target casts a spell of 1st level or higher, the target takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage per spell slot level, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

{@bold Hex.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.
Soul Leech
Elite Hex Spell. For 10 seconds, whenever target foe casts a spell, you steal up to 16...67...80 Health from that foe.

spell.name: Mantra of Recall
entries: Chant a mantra of recall, potentially regaining spend spell slots at the end of it.
For the duration, when you expend a spell slot to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 15 or higher, you regain that spell slot when this spell ends.

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Mantra of Recall
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 20 seconds, you gain no benefit from it. You gain 10...22...25 Energy when Mantra of Recall ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the level of the spell increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mist Form
entries: Partially turn your body into mist, taking less damage from foes affected by water themed spells and healing all allies around you when casting an elemental spell.

For the duration, when you take damage from an enemy affected by one or more harmful water themed spells, you can roll {@dice 4d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage. Additionally, when you cast an elemental themed spell of 1st level or higher, choose any number of friendly creatures within 150-feet of you. A target regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} per spell slot level.

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Mist Form

Elite Enchantment Spell. For 10...38...45 seconds, you take 33% less damage from foes under the effects of Water Magic hexes. Whenever you cast an elemental spell, all non-spirit allies in earshot are healed for 50...210...250% of the Energy cost of the spell.

components.m: a bottle of captured mist

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the number subtracted increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 4th and the healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Earth Shaker
entries: Jump up into the air, shattering the earth around your target, knocking creatures {@condition prone} around them.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Target each creature other than you in a 5-foot-radius centered on the target. Make a melee weapon attack against each target. On a hit, a target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target is knocked {@condition prone}.

{@bold Adrenaline.} Instead of expending a spell slot, you cast this spell by expending 8 adrenaline. When casting this spell at a higher level, expend an additional 8 adrenaline per level above the original level.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Earth Shaker
Elite Hammer Attack. Target foe and all adjacent foes are knocked down. (50% failure chance with Hammer Mastery 4 or less.)

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or 3rd level, the number of attacks increases by 1. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the number of attacks increases by 2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 3.

spell.name: Oath Shot
entries: Fire an all or nothing shot, which allows you to immediately cast another spell on a hit, but prevents you from using spells or abilities on a miss.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can immediately cast another spell without requiring an action.
On a miss, you cannot cast spells or use abilities until the end of your next turn.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Oath Shot

Elite Bow Attack. If Oath Shot hits, all of your skills except Oath Shot are recharged. If it misses, all of your skills are disabled for 10...5...4 seconds. (50% miss chance with Expertise 7 or less.)

components.m: a ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Shield of Regeneration
entries: Conjure a magical shield, which heals a creature every turn and reduces all damage they take.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. For the duration at the start of each of the target's turns, the target regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} and when the target takes damage, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage.
If the target drops to 0 hit points, this spell ends.

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases each by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd and the number subtracted increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.
Shield of Regeneration
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 5...11...13 seconds, target ally gains +3...9...10 Health regeneration and 40 armor.

spell.name: Soul Taker
entries: Make your attacks rip the souls out of your foes body, dealing more damage but also hurting you every time you attack.

For the duration, when you make an attack with a weapon, you take necrotic damage equal to {@dice 1d4}, which can't be reduced in any way. Additionally, your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 4d6} damage.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Soul Taker
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 3...25...30 seconds, your attacks sacrifice 15...19...20 health and deal 15...19...20 more damage. PvE Skill

components.m: a small clouded pearl

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the additional weapon damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Mantra of Recovery
entries: Start chanting a mantra of recovery, allowing you to cast multiple spell per turn.
For the duration, you can cast spells as an action, even if you already cast a spell as a bonus action on your turn.
{@bold Stance.} If you enter a new stance, this stance ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Mantra of Recovery
Elite Stance. For 5...17...20 seconds, spells you cast recharge 33% faster.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.

spell.name: Obsidian Flesh
entries: Partially turn your flesh into obsidian, reducing the damage you take, making you non-targetable by spells but preventing you from attacking and reducing your ability to cast spells.

For the duration, you cannot be targeted by hostile spells and when you take damage, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage. Additionally, regardless of your abilities or magic items, you can't make melee or ranged weapon attacks.

{@bold Bond.} For the duration, your spell save DC and spell attack bonus are reduced by 2.  You can have a maximum number of bonds active at any one time, equal to your spell casting ability modifier (minimum 1). The bond ends if the target of your bond is ever not within 300 feet of you, or you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can end a bond at any time (no action required).

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Obsidian Flesh
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 8...18...20 seconds, you gain +20 armor and cannot be the target of enemy spells, but cannot attack and have -2 energy degeneration.

components.m: a shard of obsidian

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Flourish
entries: Perform a magical flourish, allowing you to immediately afterward cast an attack spell.
Cast any non-elite spell which requires a weapon attack roll, which is of a level equal or lower than this one, ignoring requirements, casting time and components.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Flourish
Elite Skill. All of your attack skills become recharged. You gain 2...6...7 Energy for each skill recharged by Flourish.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the level of the spell increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Poison Arrow
entries: Attempt to poison and corrupt a creature, by hitting them with a {@condition poisoned} tipped arrow.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} and {@condition corruption|GuildWars|corrupted} for the duration, taking {@damage 2d4} damage.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw for each condition affecting it. On a success, that condition ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Poison Arrow
Elite Bow Attack. If Poison Arrow hits, your target becomes Poisoned for 5...17...20 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 1st.

components.m: a ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

spell.name: Spiteful Spirit
entries: Utter a spiteful curse, hexing a target to damage everything around them every time they attack or cast a spell.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save for the duration when the target casts a spell or makes an attack roll, target each creature in a 10-foot-radius centered on the target. Each target takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage.

{@bold Hex.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.
Spiteful Spirit
Elite Hex Spell. For 8...18...20 seconds, whenever target foe attacks or uses a skill, Spiteful Spirit deals 5...29...35 shadow damage to that foe and all adjacent allies of that foe.

spell.name: Migraine
entries: Drive a psychic spike into a creature's mind, causing a horrible migraine, dealing damage every turn and increasing their casting times.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save for the duration, regardless of the target's abilities or magic items, the target can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn and at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage. Additionally, the target can't cast spells as reactions, must cast spells which take a bonus action as an action, and any other spell takes twice as long to cast.

{@bold Hex.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Migraine
Elite Hex Spell. For 5...17...20 seconds, target foe suffers -1...7...8 Health degeneration and takes 100% longer to activate skills.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Over the Limit
entries: Push your spellcasting over the limit.

For the duration, you can cast spells as an action, even if you already cast a spell as a bonus action on your turn, and you can cast spells which take an action to cast as a bonus action, but any spell you cast causes you to gain 2 rounds of {@condition overcast|GuildWars}.

{@bold Bond.} For the duration, your spell save DC and spell attack bonus are reduced by 1.  You can have a maximum number of bonds active at any one time, equal to your spell casting ability modifier (minimum 1). The bond ends if the target of your bond is ever not within 300 feet of you, or you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can end a bond at any time (no action required).

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Over the Limit
Elite Enchantment Spell. While you maintain this enchantment, your spells cast 15...19...20% faster, and recharge 15...43...50% faster, but you continuously gain Overcast. PvE Skill

spell.name: Gladiator's Defense
entries: Assume the fighting stance of a gladiator, gaining AC and striking back at foes who miss.

For the duration, you have a +5 bonus to AC against weapon attacks and if a melee attack misses you because of this bonus, target the creature that attacked you. The target takes {@damage 3d6} slashing damage.
{@bold Stance.} If you enter a new stance, this stance ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Gladiator's Defense
Elite Stance. For 5...10...11 seconds, you have a 75% chance to block incoming attacks. Whenever you block a melee attack this way, the attacker suffers 5...29...35 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Practiced Stance
entries: Assume a stance practiced at applying preparations.

For the duration, when you cast a preparation spell, you can cast that spell by using a spell slot which is one level higher than the one used in the casting, cast it as a bonus action and double its duration.
{@bold Stance.} If you enter a new stance, this stance ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Practiced Stance
Elite Stance. For 20...32...35 seconds, your Preparations recharge 50% faster and last 30...126...150% longer.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the level of the spell slot increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Spell Breaker
entries: Put a magical ward on a creature, breaking any spells attempting to target them.
Choose one friendly creature that you can see within range. For the duration, the target cannot be targeted by hostile spells.

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Spell Breaker
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 5...15...17 seconds, target ally cannot be the target of enemy spells.

components.m: a piece of lead

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 8th.

spell.name: Tainted Flesh
entries: Taint the flash of a friendly creature, making them immune to diseases and causing {@condition disease|GuildWars} to any creature who attacks them in melee.

Choose one friendly creature that you can see within range. End the {@condition disease|GuildWars|diseased} condition on the target. For the duration, the target is immune to the {@condition disease|GuildWars|diseased} condition and when the target takes damage from a melee attack, target the creature that dealt the damage. The new target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition disease|GuildWars|diseased} for the duration, taking {@damage 2d6} damage.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Tainted Flesh
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 20...39...44 seconds, target ally is immune to disease, and anyone striking that ally in melee becomes Diseased for 3...13...15 seconds.

components.m: a piece of demonic flesh

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st, and you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Panic
entries: Spread panic throughout a group, preventing each other from casting spells or using abilities.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, when a target finishes casting a spell or successfully uses an ability, target each hostile creature other than the target in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. Each new target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a target can't cast spells or use abilities on their next turn.

{@bold Hex.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Panic
Elite Hex Spell. For 1...8...10 second[s], target foe and all nearby foes are hexed with Panic. When a foe hexed with Panic successfully uses a skill, all other nearby foes are interrupted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Massive Thunderclap
entries: Cause a massive thunderclap at a location of your choice, disrupting and damaging foes.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage, {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

On a failed Constitution save, a target is {@condition weakness|GuildWars|weakened} and has {@condition cracked armor|GuildWars} for the duration, and can't cast spells or use abilities on their next turn.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw for each condition affecting it. On a success, that condition ends.
{@bold Armor Penetration.} This spell's lightning/thunder damage cannot be reduced in any way, except by immunities.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Thunderclap

Elite Spell. Create a massive shockwave at target foe's location. Deals 10...42...50 lightning damage to target and all adjacent foes. Struck foes are interrupted and suffer from Cracked Armor and Weakness for 5...17...20 seconds. This spell has 25% armor penetration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Punishing Shot

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range cast a spell or using an ability

entries: You punish a creature in the process of using an ability or casting a spell.

Choose one creature, which is casting a spell or using an ability, that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, takes {@damage 2d8} damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the ability/spell fails and has no effect.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Punishing Shot
Elite Bow Attack. If Punishing Shot hits, you strike for +10...18...20 damage and your target is interrupted.

spell.name: Hundred Blades
entries: Quickly flourish your blade when attacking, damaging everyone around you.

For the duration, if you are wielding a melee weapon which deals slashing damage, when you make a melee weapon attack roll, target each creature other than you within 5-feet. A target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Hundred Blades
Elite Skill. For 15 seconds, whenever you attack with a sword, all adjacent foes take 10...22...25 slashing damage.

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp which deals slashing damage

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Unyielding Aura
entries: Envelop yourself in an unyielding aura, which makes all your spells heal for more and resurrects on end.
For the duration, when you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can roll {@dice 4d4} and add the number rolled to the amount of hit points restored.

When this spell ends, randomly choose one friendly creature, which has not been dead for more than 1 minute, that you can see within range. The target returns to life with 100% of their maximum hit points at your location.

{@bold Bond.} For the duration, your spell save DC and spell attack bonus are reduced by 1.  You can have a maximum number of bonds active at any one time, equal to your spell casting ability modifier (minimum 1). The bond ends if the target of your bond is ever not within 300 feet of you, or you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can end a bond at any time (no action required).

{@bold Enchantment.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Unyielding Aura

Elite Enchantment Spell. While you maintain this enchantment, your Monk spells heal for +15...51...60% more Health. When this enchantment ends one random other party member is resurrected with full Health and Energy and teleported to your location.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Well of Power
entries: Extract the remaining magic of a corpse, healing allies in its area every turn, and empowering their magic.

Choose one dead creature, which has not been dead for more than 5 minutes and which has not been exploited by a spell, that you can see within range. Exploit that target, for the duration, each friendly creature in a 20-foot-radius centered on that point regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. Additionally, when a friendly creature casts a spell while inside the spell's area, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 16 or higher, the spell does not expend a spell slot.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Well of Power

Elite Well Spell. Exploit nearest corpse to create a Well of Power at that location. For 8...18...20 seconds, allies within the area of Well of Power gain +1...5...6 Health regeneration and +2 Energy regeneration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases each by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd and the number you need to roll decreases by 1 for every 2 slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Signet of Midnight
entries: Touch a creature, plunging you both into midnight, blinding you both.
You touch a creature. The target and you are {@condition blinded} for the duration.
{@bold Signet.} Casting this spell does not cost a spell slot. Once you cast this spell, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Signet of Midnight
Elite Signet. You and target touched foe become Blinded for 15 seconds.

spell.name: Ward Against Harm
entries: Conjure a watery ward at your location, protecting your allies from damage and healing them every turn.

Conjure a 20-foot radius stationary ward at your location for the duration and choose any number of creatures. When a target takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, if the target is in the radius of the spell, you can roll {@dice 2d6} and subtract the number rolled from the damage.
Additionally, when a target takes damage, if the target is in the radius of the spell, you can roll {@dice 2d6} and subtract the number rolled from the damage.
Also, each friendly creature regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier when it enters the ward's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Ward Against Harm

Elite Ward Spell. Create a Ward Against Harm at this location. For 5...13...15 seconds, non-spirit allies in this area have +1...3...3 health regeneration, +12...22...24 armor, and an additional +12...22...24 armor against elemental damage. This spell is disabled for 20 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number subtracted each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd and the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Thousand Weapons Stance
entries: Gain mastery over all weapons.
For the duration, the number you need to roll to score a critical hit is reduced by 5, and you can attack one additional time when you take the attack action on your turn.
{@bold Stance.} If you enter a new stance, this stance ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Seven Weapons Stance
Elite Stance. For 3...17...20 seconds, your weapon attributes are increased by +1...12...15 and you attack 33% faster. PvE Skill

spell.name: Spike Trap
entries: Prepare a spike trap, which damages, cripples and knock creatures {@condition prone} which trigger it.

Conjure a 15-foot radius stationary {@condition invisible} trap at your location for the duration and choose any number of creatures. The next time a non-chosen creature enters the spell's area, the trap triggers, applying the following effects for 2 rounds:

Each non-chosen creature must make a Dexterity saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d8} piercing damage, becomes {@condition crippled|GuildWars} for one minute and is knocked {@condition prone}.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Spike Trap

Elite Trap. When Spike Trap is triggered, every second (for 2 seconds), all nearby foes are struck for 10...34...40 piercing damage, become Crippled for 3...21...25 seconds, and are knocked down. Spike Trap ends after 90 seconds. While activating this skill, you are easily interrupted.

components.m: a bundle of sharp sticks

entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Word of Healing
entries: Utter a Word of healing, which heals low health creatures for more.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. If the target was below 50% of their maximum hit points, they regain additional hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing each increases by {@scaledice 1d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.
Word of Healing
Elite Spell. Heal target ally for 5...81...100 Health. Heal for an additional 30...98...115 Health if that ally is below 50% Health.

spell.name: Wither
entries: Curse a creature's flesh to wither, dealing damage to them every turn and reducing their spellcasting ability.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save for the duration at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. Additionally, for the duration, when the target expends a spell slot to cast a spell, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 5 or lower, the spell expends an additional spell slot. If an additional spell slot is expended this way, this spell ends and the target takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage.

{@bold Hex.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Wither

Elite Hex Spell. For 5...29...35 seconds, target foe suffers -2...4...4 Health degeneration and -1 Energy degeneration. If target foe's Energy reaches 0, that foe takes 15...63...75 damage and Wither ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Time Ward
entries: Create a pocket of space where time passes differently for allies inside it.

Conjure a 20-foot radius stationary ward at your location for the duration and choose any number of creatures. For the duration, if a target is in the radius of the spell, they can cast spells as an action, even if they already cast a spell as a bonus action on their turn, and a target can cast spells which take an action to cast as a bonus action.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Time Ward
Elite Ward Spell. You create a Time Ward at your location. For 3...13...15 seconds, non-spirit allies in this area cast spells 15...19...20% faster and recharge skills 15...19...20% faster. PvE Skill

components.m: a broken clock

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to 1 hour.

spell.name: Water Trident
entries: Conjure up a watery trident and throw it at up to three creatures, knocking {@condition prone} moving targets.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. Target up to two other creatures other than the target in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. Make a ranged spell attack with advantage against each target. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and, if a target willingly moved on its last turn, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target is knocked {@condition prone}.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Water Trident
Elite Spell. Send out a fast-moving Water Trident, striking target foe and up to 2 adjacent foes for 10...74...90 cold damage if it hits. If it hits a moving foe, that foe is knocked down.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shadow Theft
entries: Shadow step to a creature, draining their magic and empowering your own.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. Teleport within 5 feet of the target to an unoccupied space. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save for the duration, the target must cast spells by using a spell slot which is one level lower than the one used in the casting, and you can cast spells by using a spell slot which is one level higher than the one used in the casting.
{@bold Lead Attack.} On a failed save, this spell is considered a lead attack. Additionally, you can, immediately after a failed save, cast an off-hand attack spell as an action or bonus action.

{@bold Enchantment/Hex.} Treat this spell as if you were maintaining {@status concentration} on it, except that it does not break {@status concentration} of other {@status concentration} spells when cast, nor does it break {@status concentration} on itself when other {@status concentration} spells are cast.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Shadow Theft

Elite Skill. Shadow Step to target foe. For 5...17...20 seconds that foe's attributes are reduced by 1...4...5 and your attributes are increased by 1...4...5. This skill counts as a Lead Attack. PvE Skill

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 45 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Signet of Judgment

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range make an attack roll

entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of making an attack roll and smite all creatures around it.

Choose one attacking creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the attack roll misses and target each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. A target takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
{@bold Signet.} Casting this spell does not cost a spell slot. Once you cast this spell, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
{@bold Elite.} When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.
Signet of Judgment
Elite Signet. Target foe is knocked down. That foe and all adjacent foes take 15...63...75 holy damage.

spell.name: Mend Ailment
entries: Magically cure a condition from a creature, healing them for every condition remaining on them.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. End the latest of the following conditions on the target: {@condition Corruption|GuildWars}, {@condition Disease|GuildWars}, {@condition blinded|phb|Blindness}, {@condition Dazed|GuildWars}, {@condition Bleeding|GuildWars}, {@condition Crippled|GuildWars}, {@condition Burning|GuildWars}, {@condition Weakness|GuildWars}, {@condition Cracked Armor|GuildWars}, or {@condition Deep Wound|GuildWars}. Then the target regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} per condition affecting it.
Mend Ailment

Spell. Remove one condition (Poison, Disease, Blindness, Dazed, Bleeding, Crippled, Burning, Weakness, Cracked Armor, or Deep Wound) from target ally. For each remaining Condition, that ally is healed for 5...57...70 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Glyph of Concentration
entries: Inscribe a glyph of {@status concentration} into your spellcasting focus, improving the next {@status concentration} spell you cast.

For the duration, the next time you cast a {@status concentration}, enchantment or hex spell, you cannot be interrupted while casting it, you have a +5 bonus to Constitution saving throws made to hold {@status concentration} on that spell, and you ignore the {@condition dazed|GuildWars} condition for the casting of that spell.
Glyph of Concentration
Glyph. For 15 seconds, your next 1 spell cannot be interrupted and ignores the effects of being Dazed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of time this spell can trigger increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Bull's Strike
entries: Attempt a bull's strike, knocking {@condition prone} moving foes.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and if the target willingly moved on its last turn, the target takes an additional {@damage 2d8} damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.
Bull's Strike
Melee Attack. If this attack hits a moving foe, you strike for +5...25...30 damage, and your target is knocked down.

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Plague Touch
entries: Touch a creature with plague infested hands, transferring conditions.

Choose one creature within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target gains a copy of the latest 2 of the following conditions on yourself: {@condition Bleeding|GuildWars}, {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Burning|GuildWars}, {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Corruption|GuildWars}, {@condition Cracked Armor|GuildWars}, {@condition Crippled|GuildWars}, {@condition Dazed|GuildWars}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Deep Wound|GuildWars}, {@condition Disease|GuildWars}, {@condition Exhaustion}, {@condition Frightened}, {@condition Poisoned}, {@condition Weakness|GuildWars}. End all copied conditions on yourself.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw for each condition affecting it. On a success, that condition ends.
Plague Signet
Elite Signet. Transfer all negative conditions with 100...180...200% of their remaining durations from yourself to target foe. (50% failure chance with Curses 4 or less.)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, copy one additional condition for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Griffon's Sweep
entries: Channel the power of the griffon, dive attacking, knocking {@condition prone} and damaging even on a miss.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 2d8} damage.
On a miss, the target takes {@damage 2d8} damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.
Griffon's Sweep
Melee Attack. If this attack hits, you strike for +5...17...20 damage. If this attack is blocked, your target is knocked down and suffers 10...29...34 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

outro: If the beast was not successfully charmed or a reroll is wanted, another hour can be spent to roll again.

background.name: Ascalon
entries: Once, Ascalon was a beautiful, fertile land of rolling green countryside and magnificent cities. Her people were viewed as grim by their neighbors. This was perhaps, to be expected, given their never-ending war against the aggressive Charr. Indeed, it was their unfailing vigilance, their Great Northern Wall, and the blood they shed each year to defend it that had protected not only Ascalon, but also Kryta and Orr through the ages.
Then came the invasion, and with it, the Searing.

Anyone alive today will remember the day the lands of Ascalon were blasted and torn with magic fire. Whole cities and guilds were destroyed in the Searing, and the might of Ascalon was shattered. Now the Great Northern Wall lies broken, and the Charr have overrun much of the kingdom, defiling it with their unholy shrines, killing those who stand in their way.

The survival of Ascalon hinges on but a single remaining corner of the fallen kingdomthe capital city of Rin. In the final years of the last Guild War, the people of Rin looked to a soldier named Adelbern, a simple man of humble origins, who rallied the people with his courage and cunning and steeled them not only against the guilds of Orr and Kryta but also against the terrors of the Charr.

The sudden destruction of most of the kingdom during the Searing has taken much of the fight out of the man now known as King Adelbern. He has become stubborn and set in his ways, afraid of losing what little he has left. But in his son Rurik, the people see a leader with the courage to perhaps help them reclaim their fallen kingdom.

The survivors of Ascalon live in a state of constant warfare, using hit-and-run tactics and the remnants of the Great Wall to prevent any significant advances by the Charr into their territory. King Adelbern has circled the wagons, so to speak, content to simply defend what Ascalon has left and live to fight another day. Prince Rurik, on the other hand, is far more daring than his father thinks is wise, and has even suggested that the time may be coming to launch an offensive against the Charr.

Already the rumbling of the winds of change can be heard in the streets. People are frightened. They wonder what will become of them. Some even wonder aloud if Adelbern has lost what it takes to steer Ascalon back from the brink. They wish to see the prince step up and take command of the kingdom. Perhaps under his guidance, the people of Ascalon will live on to see another golden age.

background.name: Air Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that deal lightning damage to and debilitate a single enemy, become more effective with higher Air Magic.

background.name: Assassin
entries: The Assassin walks the shadows, a deadly viper ready to strike at the heart when the enemy least expects it, nowhere and everywhere all at once. Assassins are masters of their chosen weapon, the dagger, and are expert at inflicting Critical Strikes that cause massive damage. The Assassin is trained to efficiently link attacks together in a chain that does not give the enemy a chance to hit back. They have mastered the ability to move as shadowsAssassins wear only lightweight armor and prefer to avoid damage by not being there when the enemys strike lands. Their other magical skills include Hexes that lower the targets defenses and protect the Assassin from harm.

background.name: Axe Mastery
entries: Axe Mastery increases the damage you do with axes and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using an axe. Many skills, especially axe attack skills become more effective with higher Axe Mastery.

background.name: Beast Mastery
entries: Beast Mastery increases the damage dealt by your animal companion and its chance to inflict a critical hit. Many Ranger skills, especially those related to making your animal companion stronger, become more effective with higher Beast Mastery.

background.name: Blood Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Necromancer skills, especially spells that damage and steal health from your foes, become more effective with higher Blood Magic.

background.name: Channeling Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Ritualist skills, especially those related to lightning damage and Energy, become more effective with higher Channeling Magic.

background.name: Charr Homelands
entries: The Charr Homelands lie to the north of Ascalon and, as the name implies, is the current homeland of the Charr. Its geography is much like how Ascalon was before the Searing and is home to Grawl, Skale, Worms, and a variety of Devourers among other creatures. Its true name is unknown.
The Elder Dragon Kralkatorrik can be seen sleeping in the center of this region, between the three explorable areas.

background.name: Command
entries: No inherent effect. Many Paragon skills, especially those that protect your allies or increase your tactical position on the battlefield, become more effective with higher Command.

background.name: Communing
entries: No inherent effect. Many Ritualist skills, especially those related to summoning Spirits, become more effective with higher Communing.

background.name: Critical Strikes
entries: For each rank of Critical Strikes you have, you gain an additional 1% chance to critical hit. Whenever you critical hit, you gain 1 energy at ranks 3 and above, 2 energy at ranks 8 and above, and 3 energy at 13 ranks above.

background.name: Crystal Desert
entries: Legends tell of a time, thousands of years ago, when the Crystal Desert was covered in water. These legends claim that it was the gods who raised the land, leaving it bare and empty in order to give the solitary creatures of the world a place to call their own. If the legends are true, humans were not among those for whom this land was made. There have been attempts by humans to settle in the desert, but they have, without exception, failed miserably, leaving behind only the grand monuments they built here proclaiming their short-lived triumph over this harsh land.

The weather in the Crystal Desert is hot and unforgiving. The winds blow hard, making and unmaking dunes, covering up the present and uncovering the past. An examination of the sand will reveal that each grain is actually a tiny, pointed crystal. In isolated locations, larger crystal formations have been revealed by the constant, unforgiving wind.

background.name: Curses
entries: No inherent effect. Many Necromancer skills, especially Hex spells which reduce your foes' effectiveness in battle, become more effective with higher Curses.

background.name: Dagger Mastery
entries: Dagger Mastery increases the damage you do with daggers and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using a dagger. There is a 2% chance per rank of Dagger Mastery that attacks from your daggers will double strike. Many skills, especially dagger attack skills, become more effective with higher Dagger Mastery.

background.name: Deadly Arts
entries: No Inherent effect. Many Assassins skills, especially those related to harming enemies, become more effective with higher Deadly Arts.

background.name: Death Magic
entries: Without Death Magic, you can control no more than two undead servants. For every two ranks of Death Magic, you can control one additional undead servant. Many Necromancer skills, especially those that animate undead servants, manipulate corpses, and deal cold damage, become more effective with higher Death Magic.

background.name: The Desolation
entries: The Desolation is situated on the northwestern portion of Elona, connected to the Crystal Desert. It is one of the most hostile regions on Tyria due to its sulfurous sands. It is riddled with poisonous sulfur deserts and is home to many undead creatures and the great Junundu wurms. The land was once under the rule of Palawa Joko but following his imprisonment the undead armies have gone through schisms and formed smaller groups.

The Desolation was once the coast of the Crystal Sea, and described as being a 'valley of verdant growth.' It was here that Abaddon was cast down by the other gods and banished into the Realm of Torment. His fall shattered and poisoned the land, turning it into what it is now. As the place where he was cast down, the Desolation is the part of Tyria closest to the Realm of Torment and it has begun to leak through and twist the already damaged lands.

background.name: Divine Favor
entries: For each rank of Divine Favor, allies are healed for 3.2 whenever you cast Monk spells on them. Several Monk skills, especially spells related to Energy gain and healing, become more effective with higher Divine Favor.

background.name: Domination Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Mesmer skills, especially spells that disrupt spell-casting and deal direct damage, become more effective with higher Domination Magic.

background.name: Earth Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that protect you and your allies or deal earth damage, become more effective with higher Earth Magic.

background.name: Earth Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Dervish Spells, especially those dealing with defense or Earth damage, become more effective with higher Earth Prayers.

background.name: Elementalist
entries: Elementalists summon the powers of earth, air, fire, and water and command them at will. They can inflict more damage in a single strike than any other profession. Earth Magic summons quakes and eruptions, encases enemies in stone, or protects allies. Air Magic harnesses the power of tempests to strike foes down with lightning or enable allies to run like the wind. Fire Magic manifests flames, fireballs, molten lava, and even meteors to burn enemies to a crisp. Water Magic conjures mist and ice to slow enemy movement and attacks, blur vision, protect allies against magic, and inflict cold damage on enemies. Elementalists have access to Energy regenerating skills, and when chosen as a primary character, they can increase their maximum Energy over time. The wise Elementalist avoids becoming surrounded, but keeps a local area-of-effect spell on hand just in case.

background.name: Elite
entries: Elite skills are skill types that have been specially designated by the designers as being more significant than non-elites. Players may only include one elite skill in their build. However, under special circumstances, a skill bar might have several Elites and this is explained below in copying Elite Skills.

Elite skills are meant to have powerful effects. Many builds are often constructed around (and named after) their elite skill. The choice of this type build leads to many of the remaining skill choices. A few examples of such elite skill-based builds include Barrage Ranger, Spiteful Spirit Necromancer, Healer's Boon Monk, Vow of Strength Dervish, Signet of Spirits Ritualist, Crippling Shot Ranger or Panic Mesmer.

background.name: Energy Storage
entries: For each rank of Energy Storage, your maximum Energy raises by 3. Several skills related to gaining Health or Energy become more effective with higher Energy Storage.

background.name: Expertise
entries: For each rank of Expertise, the Energy cost of all of your attacks, Rituals, touch skills and Rangers [sic] skills are decreased by 4%. Several skills, especially those related to Energy costs and skill recharge times, become more effective with higher Expertise.

background.name: Fast Casting
entries: Fast Casting decreases the activation time of your Spells and Signets. (No effect for non-Mesmer skills with an activation time less than 2 seconds.) In PvE, each rank of Fast Casting decreases the recharge time for your Mesmer Spells by 3%.

background.name: Fire Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that burn your foes or deal fire damage in large areas, become more effective with higher Fire Magic.

background.name: Hammer Mastery
entries: Hammer Mastery increases the damage you do with hammers and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using a hammer. Many skills, especially hammer attack skills become more effective with higher Hammer Mastery.

background.name: Healing Prayers
entries: No inherent effect. Many Monk skills, especially spells related to healing, become more effective with higher Healing Prayers.

background.name: Illusion Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Mesmer skills, especially spells that deceive your foes and hinder their movement and attacks, become more effective with higher Illusion Magic.

background.name: Inspiration Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Mesmer skills, especially spells that generate energy and reduce damage, become more effective with higher Inspiration Magic.

background.name: Kaineng City
entries: Kaineng City is the capital of the Empire of the Dragon. It is a huge metropolis that covers a large portion of northwestern Cantha. 'Kaineng' is Old Canthan for 'Emperor', giving the city the name of 'Emperor City.'

background.name: Kourna
entries: The province of Kourna is eternally ready for war. Military historians analyze the great battles that have taken place here: the epic conflicts of Primeval Kings, the desperate efforts to unite the land in the Shattered Dynasty Era, and of course, Turai Ossas defeat of Palawa Joko near the Grand Cataract at Jahai. For centuries, Kourna has had a military government, and its leaders have been direct descendents of Warmarshal Turai Ossa. Inspired by his example, Kournans revere loyalty, patriotism, a strong sense of duty, and dedication to military service. Not every Kournan is a soldier, but farmers laboring in the fields and crafters slaving in workshops know the value of a safe and secure province. The strength of the state depends on loyalty to its leaders. Pacified Centaur laborers add to the provinces muscle. Typical Kournan dedication drives citizens to work hard for prosperityin fact, the entire nation relies on the provinces agriculture and handiwork. Kournan adventurers go to war secure in the knowledge that their swords are well-tempered and their armor well-made, forged as surely as the soldiers who wield them.

background.name: Leadership
entries: You gain 2 Energy for each ally affected by one of your Shouts or Chants (maximum 1 Energy for every 2 ranks).

background.name: Maguuma Jungle
entries: Years ago, many tribes of human druids lived among the Maguuma's lush greenery and wildlife. But it has been a long time since anyone has heard word from them, and many believe that they were eaten by hostile jungle creatures or simply swallowed whole by the man-eating plants now rampant in the jungle.

The higher elevations are mostly devoid of water. Only the largest and hardiest of plants can live here. But down farther, closer to the water table, the Maguuma grows thick. The vegetation can become so dense that there are areas of the jungle floor that have never been touched by the sun's light.

background.name: Marksmanship
entries: Marksmanship increases the damage you do with bows and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using a bow. Many Ranger skills, especially bow attack skills, become more effective with higher Marksmanship.

background.name: Mesmer
entries: Mesmers are masters of illusion and control, subverting the enemys Energy for their own use, and that of their allies. Combined with any other profession, their skills provide excellent support, turning enemies powers against them and changing the very fabric of reality to hinder foes and help allies. Mesmers have the ability to cast spells quickly, which can make all the difference in the heat of battle. Their powers of domination allow them to take control of enemy skills and Energy. Their unique illusionary talents can slow or even halt enemy movement and skill casting, or cause imaginary illnesses that drain Health and Energy from foes while healing and energizing allies. While Mesmers are not known for brute strength, their ability to confuse, distract, and drain the enemys resources more than compensates.

background.name: Monk
entries: Monks employ a direct conduit to the gods, and the answers to their prayers come in the form of healing and protection for their allies and damage to their enemies. Combined with any other profession, Monks can alternate between supporting their party and dealing damage to opponents. Monks enjoy Divine Favor, which provides extra healing power, while their healing and Protection Prayers help to keep their allies strong and healthy. Smiting Prayers, on the other hand, call down divine anger on enemies, exacting holy damage that ignores armor, though damage-dealing is not the Monks specialty. What Monks lack in firepower they make up for with their unparalleled gift for keeping their allies alive.

background.name: Motivation
entries: No inherent effect. Many Paragon skills, especially those related to Energy management or that inspire your allies, become more effective with higher Motivation.

background.name: Motivation
entries: Each rank in Mysticism reduces the cost of your Dervish enchantments by 4%. In PvE, you have +1 armor per rank of Mysticism while you are enchanted.

background.name: Necromancer
entries: Necromancers , calling on the spirits of the dead, and even death itself, to overpower enemies and assist allies. In sacrificing Health and taking curses and diseases upon themselves, they can deal large amounts of damage to those foolish enough to oppose them. Dead and dying enemies become unwilling allies in their hands. Necromancers have the singular ability to absorb Energy from an enemys death, and can raise a fighting force from the corpses of their foes. Curses, which often cost the Necromancer dearly, exact an even greater toll from enemies, who find that their Enchantments and healing skills are rendered useless. Due to the sacrificial nature of their methods, Necromancers must practice patience and self-discipline to survive.

background.name: No Attribute
entries: No Attribute skills are those which are not tied to a particular attribute. Effects of these unlinked skills are almost always constant; for example, Remove Hex always removes a single hex, whereas the Protection Prayers spell, Divert Hexes removes 1...3...3 hexes, depending on the caster's rank in that attribute.

background.name: No Profession
entries: No Attribute skills are those which are not tied to a particular profession.

background.name: Northeastern Kryta
entries: There are two types of humans in Kryta: those who worship the mysterious Unseen Ones and those who do not. The worshippers have become known as the White Mantle because of the long white sleeveless robes many of them wear.

It is the responsibility of the White Mantle to oversee the other humans and impose upon them the rules and laws of the Unseen Ones. Those inside the organization receive special privileges (more food, better clothing, access to books) simply for abiding by the rules of the Unseen Ones and carrying out the orders handed down by the White Mantle high priest. To the Krytans the White Mantle are the root of law and order, the protectors or saviors, if you will, of their lands.

The White Mantle maintain a series of temples all over the continent. Members of this organization frequently, though not always, choose to reside in these temples to better perform their duties to the Mantle and to more effectively worship the Unseen Ones.

Since the end of the last Guild War and the repelling of the Charr invasion, the White Mantle have maintained a high level of military preparedness. They dont ever want to be caught off guard again, and they often keep large stores of weapons inside their temples to use in case of emergency. Its also not uncommon for followers of the Mantle philosophy to be highly trained warriors. Fighting skills will come in handy if the day comes when they will need to once again defend Kryta from invasion.

entries: There are two types of humans in Kryta: those who worship the mysterious Unseen Ones and those who do not. The worshippers have become known as the White Mantle because of the long white sleeveless robes many of them wear.
